Message.value: &Edit…
Listen for incoming data (will open the serial device)

Message.description: Window title: Custom Session Type Script Editor

Message.value: &Load from File…
We also offer Serial Port Monitoring Control ActiveX library which allows you to integrate monitoring functionality into your own application.

Item.text: The application is waiting for you to connect a PnP-compliant serial device to your computer.

Message.description: Window title: Set Custom Flow Control

Item.text:
Choose the appropriate [[[hsession type]]] for your monitoring session:

 • [[[bGeneric]]]: for default processing without any additional packet processing
 • [[[bMODBUS]]]: for locating MODBUS packets in monitored data stream
 • [[[bPPP]]]: for Point-to-Point Protocol monitoring
 • [[[bOne packet a line]]]: for protocols like NMEA
 • [[[bCustom]]]: for using advanced script-based packet splitting and joining

Turn this option [[[bon]]] if you don't have a third-party application that is going to open (or has already opened) a serial device. Having this option [[[bon]]] starts a terminal emulation session [[[iin addition]]] to a monitoring session. You might also need to configure serial port parameters in this case.\n\nTurn this option [[[boff]]] if the port is already opened by third-party monitored application, or if it is going to be opened.

Message.description: Error message: serial filter driver is missing
Message.value:
Serial Monitor filter driver is missing or its installation is incomplete or corrupted. Serial Monitoring components need to be re-installed in order to fix appllication's ability to monitor serial devices.

Press the [[[bFix Installation]]] button to open Setup and uninstall Device Monitoring Studio or just the Serial Monitoring component. After rebooting your computer, run Setup again to install it back.

Press the [[[bContinue]]] button to continue running Device Monitoring Studio (not recommended: serial device monitoring will not function).
